CHAT.comment: MOT and Chi play well together; EXP remains in the background throughout the activity. After a period of experimentation in which Mot and Chi note which objects stick to the magnets and which don't , and in which Mot and Chi observe objects being attracted to magnets without actually touching the magnet , and after a discussion of what makes magnets work , MOT and Chi move on to stacking objects on the base. Neither Mot nor Chi are able to give accurate explanations of how magnets attract certain objects. Chi does engage in some fantasy play when he pretends that some of the balls are the eggs of the turtle. Video tape does not start until later; transcript until then is solely from audio tape

u.a: whispered
whispers about turning on camera
video starts here
black base is in front of Chi; the silver circle is on the black base and five silver men are stacked on one another on the silver circle
drops horseshoe magnet
drops orange ball onto black base; it sticks and does not roll; picks it up and repeats action
whispered
clears off part of black base and places silver men on it
picks up yellow wand , moves it over platform and picks up silver men which Chi has just placed on black base
places silver men back on black base in headstand positions
moves yellow wand to edge of black base; nuts and bolts that were at the edge of the base stick to the wand
sound of magnets falling cuts off the rest of the utterance
picks up plastic teddy bear and holds it out
waves yellow wnad over plastic teddy bear in Chi's hand
looks at and holds Chi's arm
spoken too softly to hear
picks up nickel and quarter
puts the money on black base
picks up plastic turtle and moves it toward black base
holds up yellow wand with blue arrow magnet , orange ball , and two silver sticks stuck to it
MOT has placed horseshoe magnet on black base and attempts to stand a silver man on top of it
Chi places orange ball on table a short distance from yellow wand , which is also on table; the orange ball is pulled to the wand
puts ball loose on table; this time it goes to the black base
removes ball from black base; puts it on table again; this time it goes to the yellow wand
places ball on table again; ball begins to move
moves yellow wand a little closer to the ball so the ball sticks to it
MOT's hand is blocked by black base
moves yellow wand toward black base; it pulls away from Mot's hand and slides into black base
picks up yellow wand and holds it over all the magnets on the black base
whispered
clears some of the picked up magnets off the yellow wand , then puts wand back over black base
picks magnets off the black base and puts them onto the yellow wand; as Chi places a plastic magnet ball on the wand , another one moves around the wand to the bottom side
whispered
pushing yellow wand down until it sticks to magnets and black base , then pulling it up again
pulls some of the magnets off the black base; pushes the black base toward Mot
hands Mot the yellow wand
holds yelow wand over black base; moves yellow wand up and down over the base
repeats above action
takes yellow wand from Mot and puts it on silver circle , which is on the black base
pulls silver circle off black base
takes a nut a puts it on the black base
removes nut and puts silver circle back on black base
places blue checked square magnet on silver circle
puts plastic turtle on top of checked square
puts washer on black base
puts two plastic magnet balls on edge of silver circle and black base
mumbled
moves turtle back into center of black base
places balls on nuts on black base near plastic turtle
attempts to place nut on side of black base; it falls several times and then Mot puts it back on the table
attempts to place silver man on top of horseshoe magnet that Mot has just placed on black base; finally places silver man on black base
has placed two silver sticks on black base so that they point straight up and is attempting to place a nut on the top of one; eventually just places it on black base
unlcear what Chi wants to do
puts blue plastic teddy bear on the center of the black base

g.ga: construction of magnets on black base
